name: LexRiskScorer
description: An AI‑powered legal risk scoring platform that analyses contract clauses, compares them against a curated database of litigation outcomes, assigns quantitative risk scores, and recommends mitigation language to reduce exposure.

tools.name: upload_contract
tools.description: Accepts a PDF or DOCX contract file, extracts raw text via OCR/ parsers, stores it in the system, and returns a unique contract identifier for later queries.

file_path.description: Local path, URL, or cloud storage URI pointing to the contract document.

tools.name: extract_clause
tools.description: Retrieves the full text of a specific clause from a stored contract using the contract ID and a clause title or keyword.

keyword.description: Fallback keyword search if the title is not known.

tools.name: retrieve_litigation_outcomes
tools.description: Queries the internal litigation database for cases that are factually or legally similar to the supplied clause text and returns a concise list of outcomes, jurisdictions, and monetary impacts.

clause_text.description: The full text of the clause to be compared.

limit.description: Maximum number of similar cases to return.

tools.name: calculate_risk_score
tools.description: Computes a numeric risk score (0‑100) for a clause based on the clause text and the retrieved litigation case data using a weighted statistical model.

clause_text.description: The clause whose risk is being evaluated.

case_summaries.description: JSON‑encoded array of case objects returned by retrieve_litigation_outcomes.

tools.name: suggest_mitigation
tools.description: Generates recommended revised clause language or additional protective provisions aimed at lowering the identified risk.

risk_factors.description: Short description of the main risk drivers identified (e.g., "broad indemnity language").

tools.name: generate_report
tools.description: Compiles all clause‑level risk scores, case references, and mitigation suggestions into a formatted PDF report and returns a downloadable URL.

contract_id.description: Identifier of the contract to be reported on.

include_raw_cases.description: If true, embed the full case summaries in the report.

examples.description: User asks for a risk assessment of a specific clause (Confidentiality) after uploading a contract.

arguments.risk_factors: Broad definition of "Confidential Information" and no carve‑out for publicly known data.

messages.content: {"mitigation": "Limit the definition of Confidential Information to information expressly marked as confidential and add a clause exempting information already in the public domain."}

Here is the analysis of the Confidentiality clause:
- **Risk Score:** 78 / 100 (high risk)
- **Key Risk Drivers:** Broad definition of "Confidential Information" with no public‑domain carve‑out.
- **Relevant Cases:**
  1. Case C123 (CA) – $250k settlement for breach.
  2. Case C456 (NY) – $500k judgment for loss of trade secrets.
- **Suggested Mitigation:** Limit the definition of Confidential Information to information expressly marked as confidential and add a carve‑out for publicly known data.
Let me know if you would like me to apply this mitigation to the contract or generate a full report.
